metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2237 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The memcache token backend in OpenStack Identity (Keystone) 2013.1 through 2.013.1.4, 2013.2 through 2013.2.2, and icehouse before icehouse-3, when issuing a trust token with impersonation enabled, does not include this token in the trustee's token-index-list, which prevents the token from being invalidated by bulk token revocation and allows the trustee to bypass intended access restrictions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2237` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

keystone - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu3
python-keystone - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> OSSA 2014-006 jdstrand> per upstream, not really triggerable by an attacker

criterions.comment: keystone package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu3').
